block.p: Keith Olbermann is leaving Fox Sports Net's National Sports Report to anchor a Sunday night program of news, interviews and commentary for that sports cable network, industry executives said.
The hourlong program, puckishly called The Keith Olbermann Evening News, will be televised at 9 p.m. Eastern time, leading in to the National Sports Report.
Keith Olbermann is leaving Fox Sports Net's National Sports Report to anchor a Sunday night program of news, interviews and commentary for that sports cable network, industry executives said.
The hourlong program, puckishly called The Keith Olbermann Evening News, will be televised at 9 p.m. Eastern time, leading in to the National Sports Report.
Olbermann anchored his last National Sports Report on July 5. His new program will begin Aug. 6, the executives said.
Fox officials and Olbermann would not comment.

Olbermann started at Fox Sports in January 1999, in hopes of making the news program a credible alternative to ESPN's SportsCenter, which he once anchored. Now, Fox is trading Olbermann's presence five nights a week for a once-a-week showcase.

From April to December, the program will compete against ESPN's Sunday night baseball and Sunday night football. Olbermann will continue to be host of the Fox broadcast network's Saturday afternoon baseball game and Fox's baseball playoff games.
